website_summaries.verdict: Another top-tier option for decking out your PC with the best of the best in graphics cards, but its extra-sturdy construction and range of fine-tuning options help it to stand apart from the crowd.
pros: Utilizes GeForce RTX platform for superior visual performance
MSL Afterburner software allows for easy PC overclocking
Double Ball Bearings ensure cooling fan longevity
Mystic Light software controls its LED lights
cons: Its ability to process incredibly detailed 4K-ready worlds, effortlessly overclock your PC, and overall longevity comes with a hefty price tag

customer_reviews.title: Bad memory.. twice
customer_reviews.text: Both died, got founders edition 100$ cheaper at bestbuy couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Artifacting after a week... Dead
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about a week....started getting the artifacting playing battlefield V. Then it would just crash back to me desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Real good graphics card with stunning design
customer_reviews.text: It's a little more expensive than best customs 1080 ti. For example, at the time of purchase MSI 2080 RTX Trio was 800 usd and Gigabyte Aorus 1080 ti extreme 750 usd. But 2080 performs a little better than 1080 ti in real conditions especially the recent games. It is also more future proof! In the near future, DLSS and Ray tracing support will widen the performance gap. The card itself is very well made: - overall good quality build - 3 fans cooling system is very quiet and run cool at 68°C max load - RGB lightning is beautiful - brushed backplate give a premium touch
customer_reviews.author: JP Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: This card died within 3 days of owning
customer_reviews.text: RTX isn't ready yet and you shouldn't pay for it. Buy a 1080ti. They are stable and reliable....and perform at the same level as this card. My card completely degrade after owning only 3 days. This is a joke for the price point and honestly wasn't impressed with the performance either.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: 4k gaming at up to 120FPS, not overclocked....!
customer_reviews.text: I'm blown away by this card. So much at 1080p that I bought a g-sync 4k display. Performance didn't drop a lick and I haven't even tried overclocking it yet. Installation was a breeze, even with the water-cool radiator. I couldn't be happier. The only downside was that MSI had a WOW:Battle for Azeroth promotion, and I already owned the digital deluxe. So I'm giving the code to a relative.
customer_reviews.author: TheAuspex

customer_reviews.text: I couldn't even run a game for more than 5min then it crashed maybe im just unlucky got a defective one, artifacts all over the place :(
customer_reviews.author: Daweyboy

customer_reviews.title: Died in a month of use.
customer_reviews.text: Well the performance and texture detail is amazing, but the card only lasted a month before completely dying and leaving my boot screen frozen with artifacts. I personally love MSI, but I am extremely disappointed in this paticular product. Can’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Skyronaut

customer_reviews.title: Msi for Life I think lol
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a super geek so I know I'm barely pushing this to the max, regardless Iove it. I'm learning ins and out to safely push it to get the most out of the card. Worth the money if you have it. 1/12/19 updated So great card when it works, failed after 2 months or of use on two monitors. Didnt do anything to push the card to limits used everything with proper setting for game using nvidia game app failed when I started playing shadow of the tomb raider. Think God for Amazon great return policy and buyers insurance, buying another msi product 2080 non rtx second failed card with built in watercooler. Hopefully 3rd times the charm.
customer_reviews.author: Javere Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Dying After 3 Months?! Thanks nVidia!!
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months the card is showing signs of failure. No overclocking done on it (didn't even use MSI's own Afterburner software). I've been more than happy with previous MSI purchases. I think the issue is with nVidia's chips. Plenty of videos by Gamers Nexus or Joker Productions on YouTube for more details on that. I knew it wasn't a value buy, but I should mention the price. nVidia has gone drunk with the sales they made during the bitcoin mining boom. The fact that folks still need to pay $800+ for the performance of a 2yr+ 1080 ti is absurd. With all those profits, you'd think they'd QA the product better... Lessons learned for me, don't make my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: You don't get an adapter
customer_reviews.text: You don't get an adapter. All the other vendors sell rtx with the adapter as well. Tf am I supposed to do with no DVI adapter? I have a DVI monitor. Would have been nice for you to include an adapter so I didn't have to drive 40 miles and fork out an extra 20 bucks just to use the card! Other than Nvidia's stupid decision to take out the DVI slot from the rtx cards this card performs well and stays cool and quiet. Fans hit 50% max and temp hit 38 celsius max so far. I'm impressed and satisfied with this card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.. but the RMA took 8 weeks for second product
customer_reviews.text: The product is beautiful.. and today it works like a charm. Unfortunately the first one I bought went bad in 2 weeks. Looked like christmas tree lights randomly blinking in background. I should have just returned via Amazon, but went the RMA route with MSI. WOW 6 weeks later and just now got the replacement. that is a long time. Until ray traced games come into play I recommend waiting on this. If I had it to over again I would but a 1080 card and just wait.
customer_reviews.author: T. Noyes

customer_reviews.title: QUIET! Reliable!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered another RTX2080 that was by EVGA that had a VERY loud water pump. The whole point of this card is better cooling AND *quiet* operation. This card runs extremely quiet. I have no other electronics in my house, and my computer makes almost no noise at all. I tune the fans to run slow, and the water pump is not audible. Love this card.
customer_reviews.author: Eliyyahu Pitter

customer_reviews.title: From nothing to wow...
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to put in! And compared to my GTX 1060 3gb that I had prior to this RTX 2080 8gb it’s amazing! The directions were very clear, the only thing is even though I was just upgrading the same type of card- I still had to uninstall the previous software and reinstall everything!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly R.

customer_reviews.title: No issues after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this graphics card for 2 months and have had no issues (I will also add I've been running it pretty intensely, using the ULTRA setting in grand theft auto V and the most intensive shaders I could find for minecraft, all run at 60 fps or above). It runs perfectly, I have seen many people complain about having artifacts show up, but I think that's just a luck of the draw thing. Most likely this card will not have any problems though.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Petray

customer_reviews.title: suffer a defective Gddr6
customer_reviews.text: 5-star for the perfect gaming performance. 1 star for the trash gddr6. I will give 0 star for the memory if There is a such option. I am replacing another one because I believe not every rtx2080 has such memory. I just got unluck.
customer_reviews.author: masora

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet, but poorly presented.
customer_reviews.text: The device itself is very quiet, and feels well made. However the box it comes in is twice the size of similar products (yes, even ones that also include a radiator), and the plastic covering the pump was impossible to completely remove without disassembly.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: crashing during the game...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a few days, and during the game I have been delayed, crashed .... why? Assassin's Creed Odyssey- crashing, tom glancys the divizion crashing sometimes... what is happening? my config is:M/B msi megan z390 ace CPU: I7 8700K P/S corsari ax1600i Memory: corsair vergeance rgb pro 32gb 3200mhz. I payed 1024 $ fully... and card didn't works correctly
customer_reviews.author: nick vashakmadze

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best 2080
customer_reviews.text: Ran my new build through benchmarking software, userbenchmark, and this card was in the 94th percentile at the time of benchmarking. It lumps them in with other manufacturer's 2080s, so this means this card is above most of those. This is without overclocking. Seems pretty amazing running all the games I've tried on 4k, max settings, over 60 fps. Haven't seemed to hit a ceiling yet on a game, though I haven't tried many of the games that are used for benchmarking this card. I like the RGB as well, as it goes with my case quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: The card is very capable. Running it at 1440p 144hz no problem. DEFINITELY either use the included sag-bracket or vertically mount this GPU, as it is HUGE and HEAVY. I love it. My last 3 cards have been MSI and I've had no problems with their products. Happy with my purchase although the price for an x80 series GPU these days is insane. However, Compared to the other $700+ RTX 2080's, this card is a steal
customer_reviews.author: FromPlsNerf

customer_reviews.title: So far it has been amazing
customer_reviews.text: I got this a few months ago and so far so good. I've had zero issues and it pushes everything I need it to at a high level. Division 2 on ultra with no issues. There is a tiny bit of coil whine occasionally but nothing concerning or constant. Runs very cool even though it is packed pretty tightly in my older case. The card is huge. Make sure the dimensions are going to fit your case. With the nightmare the 2080s have been as far as defects go this one for me has been outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Stillabower

customer_reviews.title: Messed up after a few weeks of having the card!
customer_reviews.text: Card is awesome.. when it works.. Worked for a few weeks fine. Then the above started happening. I've tried uninstalling/reinstall drivers, reseating, same issue every time now. Will work for about 10-15 mins then the ends up crashing and have to reboot. I have an MSI 1070, that works great and no errors at all. Def. something w/ the card.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Best in class 2080. Bar none..
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS CARD!!! I upgraded from my old 780Ti and now I feel like I'm flying in game xD. I purchased this card due to its phenomenal fan cooling, best in class design (IMO), and its awesome performance for the price. Needless I was not disappointed ... My only real gripe with this card since owning it is that there isn't more RGB to help me get extra frames in my games. Otherwise, I would not choose any other card over the gaming x trio.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Reid

customer_reviews.title: Quiet! Get photos of SN on the card first thing!
customer_reviews.text: This card costs much more than the base models. For that you get a card that boosts to 2055mhz or so without having to do anything & stays cool. I Got an extra 85mhz with Afterburner. The card is quiet. It came with a code for games from amazon in an email, GOT ANTHEM METRO EXODUS & BATTLEFIELD V. MSI has some promotions you get by doing reviews and submitting them. I'm getting 55 fps in 4k on Witcher 3 max settings, GTA V @ 35 to 45 fps in 4k maxed, playable no lag.
customer_reviews.author: Triko

customer_reviews.title: SEXY PIECE OF HARDWARE
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I am not a genius when it comes to numbers of this card or what most of this fancy card beholds within do but all I know I can run high-ultra settings on GTA V, RED DEAD 2, Witcher 3... and get 70-120 frames. This makes my games so pretty! Do buy if you can... you will not regret it, I sure as hell didn't
customer_reviews.author: J Luna

customer_reviews.title: From a gtx 970 to a rtx 2080
customer_reviews.text: The msi trio is perfect for my RGB build. I really wanted the 2080ti but it was unavailable and honestly as much as I game now I realize I don’t need such a high end machine for myself; However I like when my friends come over to my house and see all the RGB behide the tinted glass makes for a fun conversation piece. Something to note the card was huge I had to move my one fan to the top to fit the card into my fractal design meshify C case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What’s better than a ek block already installed with warranty?!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t seen any reviews on this card specifically. It’s an amazing card. Was able to overclock it more than the RTX 2080 gaming x trio I had since it’s watercooled. Performance is amazing and looks are even better!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: MSI Gaming X Trio 2080
customer_reviews.text: This is a great card and the most powerful one I have owned. Pros: - Card runs quite cool due to the extremely large heatsink. - Top notch performance on all games so far. - Price was not terrible - Fans do not always run due to the size of the heatsink. - Comes with a support bracket. - MSI RGB has great options. Cons: - This card is HUGE.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Beware of titles that are free with video card purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this card in March. It cam with three free titles. The email with the registration code said NOTHING about an expiration date. None of the warnings on the purchase site said that you had a time limit to register the titles. Just that there was a time limit to purchase the card to get the titles free. Now I have no access to two of the supposed free titles because there was a hidden time limit. This is what I see now when I try to register for the other titles... ! Warning Your code has expired. Sorry, some promotions are only available for a limited time.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great FPS. Large card. Fans sufficient to cool.
customer_reviews.text: Great frame rates. The fans keep the card temperature at good levels. The software allows to set own fan curve (fan speed based on card temperature). The card is very long and large. Double check you measurements. I had to “customize” my case a little bit to install the card.
customer_reviews.author: Peanuts

customer_reviews.title: What
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card under the impression that I would receive a free copy of the new call of duty with it, as Amazon "was" part of the nvidia promotion. Fast forward to the day I recieved the card all parties (msi,nvidia,amazon) claim that amazon was not participating in this give away. I specifically have the screenshot with amazon listed when I bought it but nobody wants to back it up 2 thumbs down!
customer_reviews.author: eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Poor details on promotion
customer_reviews.text: Card has worked great for the most part. Very pricey, but worth it if within your budget. My main issue is that a promotional credit was bundled with the purchase, however the code expired roughly a month after I received it with NO indication of the expiration date on the email with the delivered promotional code. Not sure if this is on Amazon or NVIDIA, but if you buy the card as part of a promotion download it IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wiesneth

customer_reviews.title: Died after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in November before it died (bad memory similar to other reviews). That makes me 2/2 for MSI GPU issues. Will update review after I get the repaired on back and see if it lasts any longer. New unit lasted less then 2 months before having the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Peterson

customer_reviews.title: MSI Gaming GeForce RTX 2080 trio
customer_reviews.text: I don't really understand the price per performance seeing as the 1080ti is almost same price, but that's not msi's fault. RTX was kinda of a let down in general. As far as the pcb and heatsink, it's well made. Another well built GPU from MSI, quiet cool and overclockable. Hopefully next series isn't such a let down as far as performance.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S.

customer_reviews.title: Huge card
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from an ASUS Strix 980 Ti to this 2080. Barely fits in my Corsair 540 case. I'm very satisfied with performance on 2k resolution. Nier Automata with Far, and texture mods (60 FPS locked), Witcher 3 (60 FPS locked), APEX (144 FPS), Division 2 (~90 FPS). My card runs 2310 mhz core clock and 8000 mhz memory clock with no voltage changes. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: works wonderfully stays cool runs latest triple A games at max graphics and looks awesome !
customer_reviews.text: use this for gaming and streaming and it looks and works amazing 100 plus FPS on any game i own several of which are new titles that have come out in the last few months! to some this card may not be worth it but in my eyes it was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: devon brown

customer_reviews.title: I got a lemon....
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this 5 stars, because it worked beautifully for 1mhour, and then crashed, and then continued to crash on dames, every 5 minutes or less, even underclocked to the max. I’ve got more then enough pay power to run it, fresh installed Windows on an ssd, all drivers up to date.... Returning it and have another one of the samecoming within 1 week, hopefully not a lemon :)
customer_reviews.author: The Nerd Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Card
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago for a personal computer build. I haven't had any problems with it at all. The three fans seem to keep it very cool even after running for extended periods of time. The LED's are also very nice although I wish there were more preset lighting effects in the software. This card is very big so make sure to have the measurements of your case correct. I am very pleased with this card and I don't think I have even tapped into its full potential yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I could not review the product entirely as I received a damaged product and it was DOA. I will not knock off any stars for shipping. Pros: No RBG One of the best looking cards Watercooled Cons: As others have mentioned the card does require a bit of work to remove all the protective plastic. Tubing is a bit short and feels cheap
customer_reviews.author: Bee Y

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and great performance
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I wanted it to. Ultra quiet when gaming, 72-75C max with OC. Plays modern warfare on high @ 3840X1200 at >90FPS. Zero complaints (at the sale price). Full price is a bit spicy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Broom

customer_reviews.title: Great Card!
customer_reviews.text: Card looks amazing! Stays really cool too. Fans run at 25% and the card stays under 60c while I am playing World of Warcraft. Maxes out at like 65-70c while playing Battlefield V. It is an enormous card so make sure you use a GPU brace.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Ott

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Card minimal increase in performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card expecting some increase in performance coming from an aircooled G1 Gaming 1080, however this card even when watercooled and clocked does not increase performance more than 20% compared to the other generation GTX cards. I would recommend waiting for the next gen cards to come out
customer_reviews.author: Kavian Kavianpour

customer_reviews.title: Card broke down after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this card and received it Mar. 7th, card just started going bad on me went from getting 200+ FPS on very demanding games to 10 - 30 FPS. I'm very disappointed in MSI I've been a customer for them for 5+ years and this is hands down the worst product I've ever purchased from them. I would recommend buying a 1080 or 1080ti if you want this card.
customer_reviews.author: Clapped

customer_reviews.title: Stays cool but totally unstable. Crashes all the time, Low quality. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, it stays cool but crashes my entire system randomly during gameplay. Total ripoff, especially now that better cards cost a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Amazon’s fault/MSI saved the day
customer_reviews.text: When I buy something that is ensured to be in good working order even though it has the tag used. It really ticks me off that when I receive it and get the rest of my parts and find out its not in working order and left pink pixels across my resolution. Thankfully MSI was able to use warranty to fix the problem but Amazon should not put their word behind such used products if they don’t actually do anything to replace or refund when these products are defective.
customer_reviews.author: Jax B.

customer_reviews.title: Died
customer_reviews.text: Died within 2 days. Artifacts everywhere and just killed my PC.
customer_reviews.author: ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works great! No leaks, faster clock speeds than a normal 2080. And water cooled under warranty! It is LARGE so measure first. I can play any game on ULTRA and stay around 70-80 fps. RGB features work great with MSI z370 gaming 5 motherboard
customer_reviews.author: Shane R

customer_reviews.title: Beware of reviews
customer_reviews.text: Was a great card for the two months it worked. I should have listened to most of the reviews on here. Now my card died and I haven't back to the manufacturer for a refurbishment. I will update this review if it comes back in a timely good manner. We'll see. I also had to pay for shipping it back even though it wasn't even my fault it dies. $80 down the drain. Hoping it will come back as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I see everything
customer_reviews.text: So many details. I can see everything now! Even my terrible playing ability!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Brasile

customer_reviews.title: Runs great
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with it so far runs games great upgraded from geforce 770 gtx ... so i can see a huge difference my cpu is 9550 8 core and im not seeing super great fps but its due to my old motherboard ... runs decent temps at full load 61c
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Dayton

customer_reviews.title: AAAmazing!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this! It for my AMD rig and boy does this thing rip! I haven’t played and AAA games but all other games I threw in it are crushed. I play rocket league (not the most demanding game) GTFO, civ 6 ever game is Max’d and if I can run MSAA (muli sampling which is demanding on gpus) no issues what so ever. I do which the MSI on the side lighted up but it doesn’t on the sea hawk model.
customer_reviews.author: FitnessB

customer_reviews.title: It’s expensive but worth if you like power!
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing. Hardly any of my games have any issues running in 4K with most settings maxed. So I’m very satisfied with its power. Mine is pushed to 2ghz on cores so definitely has overcloak room. Love it so far keep up the good work msi.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet and a beast
customer_reviews.text: First one i got was defective it would not get above 30 fps but thanks to Amazon they exchanged it for a new one and WOW is this thing fast and Super quiet. Nice upgrade from a Gtx 970.
customer_reviews.author: James Robertson

customer_reviews.title: The Promo Code for two games are redeemed.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great card, good performance and nice noise control. A big reason I bought this is that it has the promo code for two valuable games. I was not able to redeem them since they are already redeemed. This is a sad fact that I can just, add 100$ and get a super version, why would I but this. Please, fix the promo code. I know it is not selling with code anymore. Give me mine back.
customer_reviews.author: WhiliMior

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival (possible not a new device)
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could tell you about this items performance, however, the graphics card isn't working. I'm a pretty competent computer tech and this is not my first graphics card installation. What I found to be strange was the Box wasn't shrink-wrapped it was closed just using regular packing tape. also the anti-static bag wasn't sealed which leads me to believe that this is not a new card. I'm working with Amazon to help resolve this issue will update once it is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Captlugnuts

customer_reviews.title: Best card I've personally owned to date
customer_reviews.text: Amazing card. If you are a fan of MSI products than this card does not let you down. I play every game at 4k 60fps easy, but without anti aliasing. Not much of a let down but a thing to note this card does not like to be framed capped. It is fine with vsync to keep it at your stable frame rate. I do highly recommend this card.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very well built card with great performance. Awesome LED lights. My only issue is that it's a heavy card that needs support. Install the sag support bar that comes with the card. You'll need it!
customer_reviews.author: Tatsman

customer_reviews.title: Came damaged!!!
customer_reviews.text: They sent me a faulty graphic card, and my motherboard doesn’t have any video ports, now i have to wait for a new one to start gaming. Trash seller!!
customer_reviews.author: Erick Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Not worth to purchase
customer_reviews.text: After four months used , now the system start crash and restart the pc, this is not just what I wanted, because it didn’t last for a long time.. The life of it just short ... disappeared
customer_reviews.author: John Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GPU!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really likeing this new RTX 2080!!!! this thing rocks anything you throw at it!! Highly reccomended !
customer_reviews.author: BayAreaBoss41510

customer_reviews.text: Good card ... coming from gtx 1080 but it is very large.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Hills

customer_reviews.title: Visually appealing and high performance.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card used "Very Good" condition and it came in like new. I overclocked it +120 and +750 and it holds temps below 55°C. It is a decent upgrade over my GTX 1080. Just make sure it will fit your case. I had to relocate my resivoir and re-run my loop. It looks very nice in my build.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Artifacted the moment I turned my comp on!
customer_reviews.text: Rumors are true! Artifacted the moment I plugged it in. I think I’ll wait for the dust to settle and for the new intel chips that are launching next year! Then maybe prices will stabilize a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good card, Bad cooling quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good card and performance however the quality of the liquid cooling is to be questioned. The transfer tubes are plastic and are in no way safe to be in a case full of electronics with liquid running through them. This product is poorly designed. Go with another manufacture, the card its self is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Sprague

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Was covered in coolant when I pulled it out of the sleeve, sent it back a few days ago for a replacement, we’ll see what happens UPDATE: They said they could not replace it and only refund it, guess I’m out of luck for the insurance I got on it, do yourself a favor and stick with EVGA
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Failure and Artifacting after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this card for a build a few months ago and now all it does is have constant artifacting and blue screens. Do not buy this card of you expect it to last long. Now I'm out of a GPU and cannot get an RMA. It is a sneaky ticking time bomb. I'm very upset.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: its good graphics card
customer_reviews.text: its a great graphics card, i didnt see much difference in the performance of it and my Gigabyte AORUS GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Xtreme, except i will buy msi graphics cards for now on my msi 2080 stays a lot more cooler when high end gaming then the Gigabyte AORUS GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Xtreme
customer_reviews.author: marion d. sykes

customer_reviews.title: Open box
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an open box from Amazon, everything was there and it is working great so far. No complaints and I saved a couple hundred dollars buying open box.
customer_reviews.author: Felicity

customer_reviews.title: This card will make you squirt, just like this card does.
customer_reviews.text: This card legit squirts sometimes. Like actually makes a squirting noise sometimes when the water flows. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: merit

customer_reviews.title: Plays all new games at ultra!
customer_reviews.text: I think it's worth the money when I bought them. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Card!
customer_reviews.text: The card is aesthetically pleasing, with the mystic light RGB. Was happy to find out G-Sync was compatible with my Freesync 2K monitor. Card is ultra quiet, can't hear it with the desktop sitting on desk even during heavy gaming sessions such as Diablo III, Division 2, Apex Legends, World War Z and others! Have yet to overclock and try the Ray Tracing on a game that supports it but am not disappointed with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: Great card
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card during the black friday sales and could lnt be happier! Looks great and runs cools
customer_reviews.author: Dave K

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy used cards cause they dont work
customer_reviews.text: I recieved it and it was messed up. Drivers wouldnt install. When I would try to install them my PC went to black screen and would never work. Dont buy a used card guys.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful card, Not enough games.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful card, Not enough games. Need more games built for it.
customer_reviews.author: Lwadling

customer_reviews.title: Artifacting failure almost immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Card began artifacting about ten minutes after plugged into machine. Returned next day. Won't be bothering with Nvidia products for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, if not overkill, for 1440p/144hz gaming
customer_reviews.text: I play at 1440p 144hz. Any game I throw at this video card it chews up and spits out without a sweat. Haven't had any temp problems or framerate issues in any of todays top games.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well bought it over 1080ti because it was only $50 more at the time and still no RTX games since Windows October update delayed.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse.M

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly so far
customer_reviews.text: I have only been using this for 4-5 days but so far everything works great, built whole system from the ground. The only thing I don't like is the bracket, it looks like the card is sagging even with the bracket installed. And definitely check if it fits in your case, it is a massive card
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The card is great because it's a 2080 obviously, though is very big and very heavy. It requires a support bracket to be held up.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: My Problem and Probably Others
customer_reviews.text: I bought this GPU and it was working for a split second and then just doesn’t detect after.A technician had to help me get to bottom of it and he said it was the GPU since he tried all the drivers listed on NVIDIA and on the driver & utilities disc that comes with the GPU but still it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Working great in SLI. Note: you'll need an NVLink adapter to get SLI to Work. I used the one made by EVGA.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S Gaffney

customer_reviews.title: Runs 2 monitors no problem
customer_reviews.text: I am running 2 monitors off this card with no issues. One is a 4k which looks awesome for picture quality, the other is 2k. I'd say it's a little pricey but most high end cards are now.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: GAYMERS
customer_reviews.text: Msi really outdone themselfs with their version of the RTX2080. I used the card for about a weel before i had to send it back. The rgb lights were not working. Ive tested on a few pcs and could not get them to work. Currently waiting on a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: urban

customer_reviews.title: Best in its class!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, would definitely recommend. Games well over 240 frames on Fortnite and most of the time on Modern Warfare.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel David Lowry

customer_reviews.title: It play my game no lag and streaming same time
customer_reviews.text: I cant change the RBG colour yet or idk now
customer_reviews.author: Ajani

customer_reviews.title: Great GPU for $600 Holiday Sale
customer_reviews.text: This card has been great. I bought it new for $600 so it was definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Layne

customer_reviews.title: What a beast!
customer_reviews.text: It's HUGE! Amazing quality, prime components, the visual is stupendous. Now I'm good with graphics card for a good time, and I'm extremely happy that I choose MSI.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler Branco

customer_reviews.title: Card was DOA had a ton of potential but I bought it used and it was broken when it showed up
customer_reviews.text: Skewed rating unfortunately, the card barely fit in my case but that's my fault it looked incredible with the rest of my set. Unfortunately my card was DOA and had to be returned. However I enjoyed the design of that card so much I actually plan on getting the 2070 Super Model from MSI when it becomes available
customer_reviews.author: garrett wheat

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a monster!
customer_reviews.text: Not a tech guy but this graphics card is remarkable
customer_reviews.author: Luis Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible hardware. MSI + Nvidia is my favorite choice in card.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the launch model
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work, would ve a complete dud if not for the led's still coming on
customer_reviews.author: scott sanders

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Great graphic card for the few minutes that I actually used, before I notice fluid seeping around the screw. Still waiting on a replacement from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and design
customer_reviews.text: iam a big fan of MSI and iam very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Aram

customer_reviews.title: Msi
customer_reviews.text: Had this card for 5 months now working fine .
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Wowzers
customer_reviews.text: I love how it looks, performs, and how it has opened up my eyes to 144hz + max settings
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It just works haha
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to say, was shipped to Chile super fast, and well packaged, its awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Pretty big radiator
customer_reviews.text: The normal temps are higher than I expected but are still in the good rNge
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flawless graphics card but large
customer_reviews.text: It's great for gaming, very strong graphics card. RGB lighting is amazing. Performance is phenomenal. It's silent and frequently stays below 60°C. The only problem is it's very large and you'll need a large case to fit this card in, but otherwise, it's flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Zuan Taljaard

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Hardware
customer_reviews.text: Only issue I have is the software doesnt work properly with my computer. Always says it's not compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycub Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: When you get a population on your computer ask for refund
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to fix it for 4 months only to find out that it was the graphics card not working. I just kept denying it was the graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve a moment before purchasing (oh well).
customer_reviews.text: No issues out of the box and I’ve had it for three months. Just buy the 2070 Super for close to similar performance or a little bit extra for the 2080 Super.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

product_meta.title: MSI Gaming GeForce RTX 2080 8GB GDRR6 256-bit VR Ready Graphics Card (RTX 2080 GAMING X TRIO)
product_meta.description: Size:Boost Clock: 1860 MHz| Style:RTX 2080 GAMING X TRIO| Pattern Name:SingleGeForce RTX graphics cards are the most advanced ever created. Discover unprecedented performance, power efficiency, and next-generation gaming experiences. Discover next-generation VR performance, the lowest latency, and plug-and-play compatibility with leading headsets-driven by NVIDIA VRWorks technologies. VR audio, physics, and haptics let you hear and feel every moment. Pascal is built to meet the demands of next generation displays, including VR, ultra-high-resolution, and multiple monitors. It features NVIDIA GameWorks technologies for extremely smooth gameplay and cinematic experiences. Plus, it includes revolutionary new 360-degree image capture. Turing-powered graphics cards give you superior performance and power efficiency, built using ultra-fast FinFET and supporting DirectX 12 features to deliver the fastest, smoothest, most power-efficient gaming experiences.
